resources.string: You have to select a campaign before you can add Characters to it.
Select the character(s) to edit from the list.
Create a new campaign to add characters to.
Are you sure to delete all Characters in this campaign?
Are you sure to delete this campaign and all Characters associated with it?
Scan this QR coude via \'Import Campaign\' to add it to another device.
Alternatively, tap the QR code to copy the raw campaign data and send it via Instant Messaging or E-Mail.
There already exists a campaign with the same name.\nDo you want to overwrite the existing data with the imported one, or create a new campaign?

Unable to prepare your campaign and the involved characters.
It seems you are using illegal characters in the names / descriptions. You can attempt to auto-resolve this issue and try sharing again.

In general, try to avoid special characters at all.

Could not interpret the scanned QR Code.

Are you sure you scanned the correct code?

If so
-check your camera and light / angle
-avoid special characters in campaign / player-characters texts
Choose a different campaign to do this.
Are you sure you want to delete the selected character(s) from this campaign?
The given resource text could not be interpreted.\n\nAre you sure this is the right text?
Could not save that backup. A backup with the same name already exists.
Choose from one of these backup files.
No backup data found on this device.
Failed to read information from the selected backup file.\nError information: \'%1$s\'
Missing information for Player Character at position %1$s

Calculating the dice probabilities failed due to numbers getting too small and the device tried to divide by zero.

All probabilities were rolled instead.
Due to the result being random now, individual probabilities may vary and are not accurate.
Calculating the probabilities failed. Switched to rolling.

This name generator is based on a Hidden Markov Model.

This is the same method used by modern phones when attempting text prediction and auto correction.

This means, in order to work properly a set of training data has to be provided. The generated names will be based on the structure of the provided example names.

If you have created at least one player character in this app, you can create new names based on those characters' names. With a low character count this will result in similar names, due to bad training, but it may provide a good insight how this name generator works. If you want to provide your own training data, save each set as a %1$s file in this directory:

%2$s

Every line in the file will be considered a new entry in the same set.

By default all possible names that can be created with the D&D 5e GM Screen are used by this app. Locate the %1$s file and use it as a reference.

This name generator is based on a list of manually, upfront provided names. These generated names will rely on the structure of the provided example names.

If you have created at least one player character in this app, you can create new names based on those characters' names. With a low character count this will result in similar names, but it may provide a good insight how this name generator works.

Tap on the 'examples' button to start learning how to add your own list of names to this app.

If you want to provide your own name categories, save each of these as a %1$s file here:

%2$s

Every line in the file should be a new name this app can learn from. Categories will not influence each other.

As an example all possible names that can be created with the D&D 5e GM Screen are already used by this app.
How many Names will be created at the same time?
The file containing the training data already exists.
Please wait until loading has finished.

Did you know you can add your own category?

Take a look at the menu and learn more about the way you can add more categories.
Used right, this name generator can be used universal for everything that can have a name, like cities, lands, pets, etc. These names can even be given additional flavors, like orcish or elvish influences.

You can hide this tab in the options menu.
Can\'t do that on the info page.
Name limit reached for this category.
Could not find the example file. Try creating it if you haven\'t already.
By selecting \"Context sensitive\" the App will try to auto-select an appropriate value depending on the resource names provided.

For advanced users only\nWhen attempting to create the next character for the name, this value will determine how much the previous characters influence the next. A high number with low reference names will yield slopy results.
